oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd Archive
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The admiration of Bushman women for the horse. The sound of the cantering of horses imitated by them. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-31. 8737-8740). The women sit with a rolled up kaross between their knees and slap it making the sound of the horse. 1) See also How the Bushman women show their admiration for the horse, 2) p.8737v: the women 'play' the kaross, 2) p.8738v: how the women hold the kaross between their knees while they 'play', 3) p.8739v: the noise the kaross makes as the women slap it, 4) This story is found in Book VIII-31.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: !kuppen (imitation of the sound of horses)
